content: knitwits contemporary yarn shop junko nakada overview the inspiration for this project came from an unfortunate broiler incident i won t go into the details but i needed some new potholders felted or unfelted these potholders double as attractive tableworthy trivets this project is a great skill-builder we ve added a few bonus features to the typical mitered square pattern in our version we added a knitted i- cord edging and introduce so i make stuff s youtube video on how to weave in your yarn ends as you knit we ve used brown sheep lamb s pride bulky for this project because of this yarn s yummy wool/ mohair blend the great color choices and the naturally insulating flame retardant and moisture resistant properties of the wool the knitted fabric is fairly dense and does not require a tremendous amount of felting to be an effective potholder color changes are not included in the written pattern and were made somewhat randomly on both versions if you need a quick gift or some instant gratification this is the project easy quick and something you can use everyday page 1 of 5 knitwits contemporary yarn shop junko nakada knitwits mitered corner pot holders notes mitered knitting also referred to as modular or domino knitting typically produces perfect squares by working a series of double decreases on alternate row self striping yarns like noro work very well for mitered knitting this pattern has a knitted i-cord edge on the sides this helps keep the edges clean and straight it can also be very practical because it adds structure to the edge of a fabric that might otherwise tend to stretch out and it also keeps a stockinette edge from rolling to the purl side the i-cord edge is produced by working the row up to the last 2 stitches of the row bringing the yarn forward between your needles and slipping the last 2 stitches purlwise page 2 of 5 knitwits contemporary yarn shop junko nakada color changes i love working with different colors but i dread weaving in the yarn ends when i came across a youtube demo on weaving in yarn as you knit i just had to give it a try follow the simple instructions from this youtube video and you ll reduce the finishing work when knitting in stripes source www so i make stuff com https //www youtube com/watch v=sszg6mrgrqa color changes are not included in the written pattern the red version has 6 garter ridges in each color block the green version has 3 garter ridges and now a few words about felting i hand-felted my potholders in the hottest sudsy water that i could stand i enjoy feeling the knitted fabric change in density and watching the stitches disappear a top loading washing machine can be used for wet felting wool alpaca and a wool & mohair blend will felt do not use super wash treated not to felt wool cotton rayon silk or any
